alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued September 26 at 2:26AM EDT until September 28 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. For the Coastal Flood Watch, up to one foot of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 11 AM EDT Wednesday, especially around the time of high tide. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Wednesday morning through Thursday afternoon, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 11:10 AM and 11:53 PM. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 12:57 PM and 1:22 AM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 12:21 PM and 12:46 AM. While this event will not be as severe in magnitude as the one this past weekend with Tropical Storm Ophelia, this one will be significantly longer in duration lasting through the end of the week. The worst flooding is expected during the middle and second half of the week. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 26/12 PM 3.0 1.4 1.5 1.0 Minor 27/12 AM 3.2 1.6 1.6 1.0 Minor 27/01 PM 3.6 2.0 2.0 1.0 Moderate 28/01 AM 3.8 2.2 2.1 1.0 Moderate 28/02 PM 3.7 2.1 2.0 1.0 Moderate &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
